page.title: 07FUNERAL ARRANGEMENTS
page.content: There are three benches on the Main Street.These are used by people to sit and watch the beautiful flowers in the gardens and the nice old houses.The seats have not been vandelised, this shows that people respect their village. When there is a funeral the hearse and mourners cannot go across the ford to the cemetry they have to travel on the busy A45 and then the A1.This cemetry is the one used by our village and it is quite new because some of our school went to the dedication service. Some people think that the Hail part of the Anglo Saxon name means healthy, because compared to villagers in the valleys they seem to be. JENNIFER SMITH aged 11 years
